intro: Byttneria scabra var. hastata, commonly known as the rough bark balsa, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and small, simple leaves that are often hairy beneath. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, three-lobed fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
